spans.text: Because it was a weekday, although it was past 5 o'clock, the izakaya was still deserted.
In the small shop with seven tables, only two customers were sitting at one table. And they hadn't ordered any alcohol, there was only a set meal that was half-eaten on the table.

Taki and Umiri picked a corner table to sit down. Taki noticed that the two people were looking towards them casually, but their eyes often lingered on Umiri's hollowed-out abdomen, and then they discussed in a low voice.
Taki unceremoniously glared back when the other party peeked over again, and incidentally slammed the glass of water in her hand on the table, sending a piece of ice flying.
Before long, the two people hurriedly got up and left.
Umiri chuckled and leisurely continued to recommend her favorite wines to Taki.
Don't you mind?
I don't care. I can't see them from here, so I'll just pretend they don't exist.
Huh? You can't see them, but you can hear them!
Since it's praise, I'll let them be.
Listening to these people gossip next to me makes the wine taste bad.
Is that so.
I thought that we, who have been in a band all the time, whether online or offline, are already used to this kind of thing.
At least it's better than scolding, isn't it, Taki.
I don't think so.
(Umiri, you actually show this kind of smile sometimes.)
(Even when you laughed in the past, it always felt like you were being sarcastic.)
Taki, you have a lot of expressions today.
What are you thinking about?
I was thinking, you're so different from when you were in high school.
Hmm?
...Well, Taki is the same, you've been talking like an old person all day today.
Very suspicious.
...What's suspicious.
Everything is suspicious.
At least the last time we met, you weren't like this.
It's only been less than three months.
(What should I say to get through this...)
(...Wait, why is Umiri leaning back in her chair? That "I'm watching you make it up" look... Am I being that obvious?!)
At this moment, the waiter passed by with a tray containing side dishes for sake and a 720ml bottle.
The tempting wasabi octopus, spicy clams, and mixed seaweed were gently placed on the table, briefly distracting the slightly hungry two from the topic.
(Thank goodness the food came at this time to break the atmosphere.)
(I haven't felt this seen through in a while... Thank you so much for knowing me so well...)
Let's have a drink first.
Umiri filled Taki's glass with sake.
Thank you.
The taste is indeed good.
And it's very cheap, a bottle of pure rice sake only costs 3000 yen.
Then we should drink heartily even more.
You know, I'll help with anything I can.
Taki drank the wine in the glass in one gulp.
A spicy sensation from her throat to her stomach.
(If I lie now, when Umiri knows the truth in the future... Wouldn't that be too cruel to her.)
(But in the end, I don't know what will happen when my heart stops beating.)
(And, would anyone really believe it?)
Taki filled her second glass.
She felt Umiri's gaze and knew that she should give an answer as soon as possible.
She took a big gulp of wine, her stomach felt heavy, and the increased alcohol in her blood made her head dizzy.
At this time, grilled skewers and sashimi were brought to the table.
Taki casually picked up a chicken heart skewer to taste, delaying her answer.
The amount of salt and the heat were just right, it's a good shop.
I'm glad you like it.
(...Once I finish this one, I have to give an answer no matter what. Is this really okay? I'm just adding unnecessary worries to her.)
(But if I don't say anything at all, Umiri won't let it go.)
...I've been composing a song these past two days, but it hasn't been going well.
Maybe I'm being affected by that.
...Just because of songwriting?
There's nothing else that can bother me, you know that.
I almost forgot, speaking of which, you have to drive later, is it okay to drink?
(Sorry, let me just gloss over it like this.)
Don't worry, I won't get drunk with this little amount.
Such bravado. This wine is quite strong.
That's how you get the feeling of drinking.
Umiri put the glass to her lips and slowly sipped.
Her face didn't change at all. On the contrary, Taki's face was already slightly flushed from the alcohol.
You're still the same, you get boastful as soon as you drink.
Hmm?

If I remember correctly, the person who said they were going to play on the panda seesaw in the park after getting drunk, and kept shouting that they were going to make the world's number one song for MyGO!!!!! was...
H-Huh?!
Who was it that was so drunk that they used the janitor's broom as a bass and pointed at the trash can asking me why I wasn't coming on stage to play together?!
That shows that I'm still thinking about performing even when I'm drunk, very professional.
(Damn it, I really can't argue with this guy.)
Yeah, Taki is the same, whether you're sober or drunk, you're always thinking about composing songs, always like this.
...I really have a song that I can't finish composing right now, I've been worried for days.
It's not the first time.
(I was momentarily speechless.)
...Because this song is not only important, but the deadline is very tight.
I see.
Then good luck.
(After asking so much, in the end, just one sentence "Good luck"?)
You haven't changed much in that regard either, sometimes you look like you don't care about other people's lives at all.
(Umiri, who has become more humane, Umiri, who hasn't changed her sharpness, what exactly is it that makes me uncomfortable...)
(There are always things that change and things that don't change, that's the norm... That story, is it called the Ship of Theseus?)
(After what degree of change is Umiri no longer "Umiri"?)
(...Maybe even without the countdown, "Taki Shiina" would have died long ago.)
Taki wanted to pour herself another glass, but Umiri's hand covered the mouth of the glass.
Taki looked over in dissatisfaction.
Umiri calmly took the wine glass from her hand, drank the remaining wine herself, and returned the empty glass to Taki.
You have one yourself, don't you.
This is not the way to enjoy drinking.
I don't want to have to transport another drunk later.
...I'll drink slowly.
Put it back. It's a rare gathering.
However, Umiri just filled Taki's empty glass and put the bottle back by her feet.
The small wine glass can only hold a maximum of two sips at a time.
...You're the one being preachy, Umiri.
Umiri didn't answer, she just drank a glass comfortably and refilled it before looking at Taki, who had been staring at her.
Looking calmly.
She was particularly insistent today.
Well, I just think Taki is being unusually fussy today.
Like asking me what clothes I'm wearing, if I'll catch a cold, if anything has changed. You wouldn't have cared about these things before.
You only focus on what's in front of you, you've been like that since high school~
But Taki is more caring now, that's a commendable improvement.
You've said everything.
Even if you and I change more, as long as it's not for the worse, there's no need to delve into it, right.
If that's the case.
CG unlocked: Cheers
May your changes always be in a good direction, cheers.
Hah.
Cheers.
Later, do you have any plans?
No, why?
I have a place I want to go.
If you're free, come with me.
With only one night left, this invitation comes at such an inopportune time.
There are [@v100] days left.
Even being away for [@v100] hours is the limit, the suspended score is still lingering in her mind, she doesn't dare to ask for more.
What's more, the secret defense line is already crumbling, and if she continues to have Umiri by her side, Taki can't guarantee what she will say.
Let's say goodbye here, they all have things they need to be busy with, it's always been like this.
...Sorry, Umiri.
The deadline for the song is really...
She has never composed for a band other than MyGO!!!!!.
And MyGO!!!!!'s leader never sets a deadline for herself - she always finishes as soon as possible.
This excuse is so clumsy that even she wants to laugh.
No, I should be the one apologizing. I shouldn't have used your time with a plan that came to mind on a whim.
I'll take you home.
......Thank you.
The alcohol and food seemed to have lost their effect, and Taki felt the cold wind and silence on the way back were gradually taking away her body temperature.
...Okay.
Taki remembered three years ago, Umiri waited four months and two days before going to a bar with her to celebrate her twentieth birthday.
That night was their first time drinking, and three years was more than enough to cultivate two mature izakaya regulars.
The successively served delicacies filled the small table, and accompanied by laughter and clinking glasses, even more side dishes disappeared without realizing it.
Taki rarely ate to nine points full, and by the time she drank the last glass, Umiri had already gotten up to pay the bill.
How much money?
It's okay. Consider it your reward for accompanying me.
Huh? How can that be?
Just treat me next time.
Okay, I'll treat you next time.
Okay, I'll come knocking to collect the debt.
...I wouldn't skip out on the bill.
At this time, the izakaya was already full of people.
Taki and Umiri walked through the narrow aisle and came outside the store, the environment instantly became much quieter.
Where are we going now?
...It's a secret.
Huh?
It's quite a long way...
Hmm? Why did the helmet fall on the ground.
Right within the range of the izakaya's lights, the helmet she had just worn actually appeared three meters away from the motorcycle.
(The helmet... is moving?)
(...It's... that black cat again?)
But this time, Taki didn't feel any tension.
(What exactly... do you want to tell me?)
As Umiri approached, the black cat no longer lingered in its newly found little nest, and lightly jumped into the darkness.
Umiri bent down to pick up the helmet, wiped the dust off with her sleeve, and turned to hand it to Taki.
It's okay, it's not like it'll save me if I crash.
(As expected, Umiri didn't see it again, not even the sound...)
Are you that doubtful of my driving skills?
Then you drive.
No.
Taki took the helmet and put it on steadily.
You're the one who's going to have their license suspended for being caught by the traffic police later.
——You're also the one who's going to be lectured for not wearing a helmet.
Don't worry. There won't be any traffic police where we're going.
